00029 /***************************************************************************//**
00030  * Header file for reading and writing to internal memory on ATmega
00031  * microcontrollers.
00032  *
00033  * References:
00034  *  - Atmel, ATmega128 Datasheet.
00035  *  - Atmel, ATmega325 Datasheet.
00036  *  - Atmel, App Note AVR910: In-System Programming.
00037  *  - Tyndall 25mm USB programming board schematic.
00038  *
00039  * @file atmega.h
00040  * @date 24-Jan-2010
00041  * @author Se√°n Harte
00042  ******************************************************************************/
00043 
00044 
00045 #ifndef ATMEGA_H
00046 #define ATMEGA_H
00047 
00048 
00049 /**
00050  * Used to get details of the atmega chip that is present, and initialise SPI
00051  * connection.
00052  *
00053  * @param memory defines what type of memory will be programmed (Flash, EEPROM,
00054  *     or fuses).
00055  * @param isSlowClock is set when a slow clock speed is needed.
00056  * @return pointer to structure containing description of memory, SPI pins and
00057  *     description in internal FT232R EEPROM.
00058  **/
00059 spiDeviceInfo_t* atmega_init(memType_t memory, bool isSlowClock);
00060 
00061 
00062 /**
00063  * Programs a number of bytes to memory. Flash, EEPROM, or fuses has been
00064  * selected by atmega_init().
00065  *
00066  * @param data pointer to bytes that will be written to memory.
00067  * @param address where to start writing.
00068  * @param size How many bytes to write.
00069  **/
00070 void atmega_write(const uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00071 
00072 
00073 /**
00074  * Reads a number of bytes from memory. Flash, EEPROM, or fuses has been
00075  * selected by atmega_init().
00076  *
00077  * @param[out] data where to store data. Must be big enough for memory type.
00078  * @param address where to start reading.
00079  * @param size how many bytes to read.
00080  **/
00081 void atmega_read(uint8_t* data, uint32_t address, uint32_t size);
00082 
00083 
00084 /** Writes 0xFF to every location in the memory. **/
00085 void atmega_erase(void);
00086 
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * When reprogramming support is needed, some data is added to the binary code
00090  * image.
00091  * @code
00092  *      /-------------------\  0x20000 (128kB)
00093  *      |  Bootloader Code  |
00094  *      |-------------------|  0x1F800 (127kB)
00095  *      |       empty       |
00096  *      |-------------------|  N + 0x10000
00097  *      |     Application   |
00098  *      |        Code       |
00099  *      |-------------------|  0x10000 (63 kB)
00100  *      |       empty       |
00101  *      |-------------------|  0x0F808
00102  *      |     App CRC       |    0x0F806
00103  *      |     App length    |    0x0F804
00104  *      |     App CRC       |    0x0F802
00105  *      |     App length    |
00106  *      |-------------------|  0x0F800 (63 kB)
00107  *      |       empty       |
00108  *      |-------------------|  N
00109  *      |     Application   |
00110  *      |        Code       |
00111  *      \-------------------/  0x00000 (0 kB)
00112  * @endcode
00113  *
00114  * @param[in,out] data program data, must be 128kB is size.
00115  * @param rawCodeSize size of code being sent to function.
00116  * @param isSupportReprog if this is zero, nothing is done.
00117  **/
00118 void atmega_addHeader(uint8_t* data, uint32_t rawCodeSize,
00119                       bool isSupportReprog);
00120 
00121 
00122 /** Resets ATmega. **/
00123 void atmega_reset(void);
00124 
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * Converts Fuse string into 3byte array. Fuse should be 6 hexadecimal digits:
00128  * @c "<ext_byte><high_byte><low_byte>"
00129  *
00130  * @param fuseString string of fuse values.
00131  * @param[out] data bytes that will contain fuse values.
00132  **/
00133 void atmega_parseFuseValues(const char* fuseString, uint8_t data[3]);
00134 
00135 
00136 /**
00137  * Prints out information of what the fuse values mean. Only for ATmega128!
00138  *
00139  * @param fuses Fuse value as 3 bytes: @c "<ext_byte><high_byte><low_byte>"
00140  **/
00141 void atmega_printFuseInfo(uint8_t fuses[3]);
00142 
00143 #endif
